name: df-pco
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cpco, cmpt(s0, ctop, cmpo(s1, s2, co(cii, ccn, cv(s0)), co(cii, ccn, cv(s0)), cmpt(s3, co(nat0, cicc, nat1), cif(cfv(cv(s1), co(nat2, cmul, cv(s3))), cfv(cv(s2), co(co(nat2, cmul, cv(s3)), cmin, nat1)), wbr(cv(s3), cle, co(nat1, cdiv, nat2)))))))
comment: Define the concatenation of two paths in a topological space ` J ` . For simplicity of definition, we define it on all paths, not just those whose endpoints line up. Definition of [Hatcher] p. 26. Hatcher denotes path concatenation with a square dot; other authors, such as Munkres, use a star. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 15-Jun-2010.)
